H0.text: In which religion is the temple, or place of worship, known as the gurdwara. Hinduism

H1.text: In which religion is the temple, or place of worship, known as the gurdwara. Buddhism

H2.text: In which religion is the temple, or place of worship, known as the gurdwara. Jainism

H3.text: In which religion is the temple, or place of worship, known as the gurdwara. Sikhi

A4.text: A gurdwara, gurudwara, or gurudwar (Punjabi: ਗੁਰਦੁਆਰਾ, romanized: gurdu'ārā, lit. 'door of the guru') is a place of assembly and worship in Sikhism, but its normal meaning is 'place of guru' or 'home of guru'.

A5.text: The etymology of the term gurdwara is from the words gur (ਗੁਰ) (a reference to the Sikh gurus) and dwara (ਦੁਆਰਾ) (gateway in Punjabi), together meaning 'the gateway through which the guru could be reached'.
